title: Stepstowealth
author: Stepstowealth
content: Individuals with visual impairment have always not been at the best position to easily accept investing in bitcoins because their eyes does not allow them the privilege of self custody, If they wish to invest in bitcoins, it has always been with someone's aid, and that cannot always be safe. People with visual impairment now have hope to have a chance with self custody with the new Elon Musk technology that can help restore their eye sight. The technology is called Blindsight. QuoteElon Musk's brain-computer interface implant startup Neuralink has received FDA breakthrough device designation for Blindsight, an implant that aims to restore vision in individuals who are blindNewsI think this is very good.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on September 19, 2024, 10:36:08 PMIndividuals with visual impairment have always not been at the best position to easily accept investing in bitcoins because their eyes does not allow them the privilege of self custody, If they wish to invest in bitcoins, it has always been with someone's aid, and that cannot always be safe. People with visual impairment now have hope to have a chance with self custody with the new Elon Musk technology that can help restore their eye sight. The technology is called Blindsight. QuoteElon Musk's brain-computer interface implant startup Neuralink has received FDA breakthrough device designation for Blindsight, an implant that aims to restore vision in individuals who are blindNewsI think this is very good. This is a great innovation that will receive universal acceptance and restore hope to many. I have interacted with those who are virtually impaired and I can confirm that they are very smart people, able to navigate through their soundings and having very sharp memory. So teaching them about Bitcoin will not be a stressful task because their brain is well developed. I can only imagine how excited many if them will be with this latest development especially when they see what opportunities abound for them in this digital space.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Looks like it's still far from usable for daily usage. Good progress nonetheless. That being said, some wallets allow people with visual impairment to access the software with a text-to-speech program/console. I'm not saying it is easy, but there is a workaround they can use if they value privacy and security more than anything. I believe you can do this with Bitcoin Core, Electrum, and more.It would be great if there is a development from the software side too. I think the last go-to recommendation for people with visual impairment is IcyWallet, which is no longer being maintained. This thread is quite old and it seems like we made little progress[1] so far. CMIIW.[1] https://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/gakj1m/accessible_bitcoin_wallet_for_the_blind/

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Elon is sure using his money for some cool stuff. I think history will be kind to him in the future. Trying to map the human brain and make us a multi planetary species is having your focus set on the right sort of goals. Outside of trying to build a Dyson sphere, he’s got as long term view approach of anyone I can think of.

comments.author: OcTradism
comments.body: Quote from: Stepstowealth on September 19, 2024, 10:36:08 PMPeople with visual impairment now have hope to have a chance with self custody with the new Elon Musk technology that can help restore their eye sight. The technology is called Blindsight.We need more results from this project but the news is very good for blind people because if this project succeeds, they will see for first time and it improves their life quality a lot. comments.author: sunsilk
comments.body: Wow, he's doing this for humanity. I can't wait to see those visually impaired people finally able to see. While this topic doesn't intend for the blinds to get into investing in Bitcoin but to see that there's still hope despite their situation.This is good and hopefully, it's going to be affordable to the ones that need it or there will be a subsidy from the government that are going to avail it.It will surely help a lot of humanity and these people will see how colorful their surroundings.

comments.author: icalical
comments.body: I Blindsight is still experimental and in early stages, and it will take a long time before it becomes widely available or proved safe for everyday use. Besides, the complexity of surgery and ethical issues due to implants cannot be ignored. People with visual impairments have been using existing tools, such as screen readers and voice commands, to safely manage Bitcoin without relying on others. Rather than waiting for this tech to evolve, focusing on improving current accessibility solutions might be a more practical approach for now.All that being said, I really hope that they will speed up the development and make this tech available widely as soon as possible, Blindsight is a very good thing.

comments.author: davis196
comments.body: Why does everything have to be connected with Bitcoin and investing? This sounds ridiculous to me.This is great news for all the blind people around the world(assuming that they could afford such expensive operation). Do we have to focus on the people with eyesight problems only as potential crypto investors? Do you really think that a blind person has enough money to invest in BTC/crypto? Do you really think that blind people are really interested in Bitcoin/crypto? Do you really think that the first thought that comes in mind to someone, who got his eyesight back is "I can see now, I should get a crypto wallet and invest in BTC or altcoins!"? This sounds absurd.

comments.body: Quote from: icalical on September 20, 2024, 05:48:11 AMI Blindsight is still experimental and in early stages, and it will take a long time before it becomes widely available or proved safe for everyday use. Besides, the complexity of surgery and ethical issues due to implants cannot be ignored. People with visual impairments have been using existing tools, such as screen readers and voice commands, to safely manage Bitcoin without relying on others. Rather than waiting for this tech to evolve, focusing on improving current accessibility solutions might be a more practical approach for now.Since the company has gotten permission from the FDA to advance animal and human testing, this new invention might soon be accessed by the public. The medical effects of this complicated surgery will be enormous. The common use of eyeglasses causes a lot of side effects, which means this one might have bigger effects. I have a visually impaired friend who can do anything to see the faces of his wife and children. Many of them will be willing to take the risk, daminng the consequences. Another problem will be the cost of this technology. It might end up being reserved for the rich. While the poor might have to sell personal belongings or go for crowdfunding to pay for this surgery. QuoteAll that being said, I really hope that they will speed up the development and make this tech available widely as soon as possible, Blindsight is a very good thing. Blindsight is indeed an uncommon invention that will bring smiles to the lives and families of those with visual impairment. And it will also open the door of opportunity for them to invest in Bitcoin. The company should take their time to make the process perfect because mistakes can lead to more complicated health problems like stroke or even death.

comments.author: Kelward
comments.body: I marvel at the speed of technological advancements and the impact it's making on human beings. To invent a blindsight technology that can restore sights for the blind has to be one of the greatest miracles of science. I applaud Elon Musk, for this milestone endeavor that will benefit people with impaired visions, I just hope that the cost will not be amount that only the super rich can afford. One of the uniqueness of Bitcoin is the privacy and freedom that it gives to it's holders but blindness can limit some people from enjoying these benefits. This milestone invention will greatly benefit the visually impaired to hodl their Bitcoin and be in full custody of their seed phrase without the help of another person.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: While technology is not available to everyone, visually impaired people should be very careful when dealing with things like high-risk investments because they will not be aware of the price and its fluctuations. They can easily make the mistake of buying through someone who is willing to help with the entire purchase operation and then have a big drop in the price and this person is hiding this factor and leaving the visually impaired person thinking that everything is fine. I see this news as being good, but only in the future when I see that all visually impaired people can have access to this technology and I would celebrate.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Finally we got something good from Elon Musk, this is very good news for those who suffer from visual impairment as this amazing invention will allow them to connect with the larger community and open the door for them to enter many fields that they were deprived of due to their disease, investing in crypto is just one of them.Such wonderful humanitarian things make me sadly wonder why world leaders do not think to use their money for useful things for the benefit of humanity instead of spending it on weapons manufacturing and mass destruction?

comments.author: Botnake
comments.body: Although this is good news, it's still in its infancy stage. According to the article posted by OP, here's what we can expect…Quote"To set expectations correctly, the vision will be at first be low resolution, like Atari graphics, but eventually it has the potential be better than natural vision and enable you to see in infrared, ultraviolet or even radar wavelengths, like [Star Trek's character] Geordi La Forge," Musk wrote on X.This one does not really help us see things like normal humans, which means it’s still challenging for us to invest since we need to read letters and numbers that require clear, human-like vision. For now, that's where we stand, but we know technology has no limits. They say that in the future, it might be possible to match or even surpass normal human vision. Let’s hope that happens.
